title: ALARA Principles
summary: ALARA (As Low As Reasonably Achievable) is the fundamental principle of radiation protection, ensuring radiation exposures are kept as low as reasonably achievable while maintaining clinical effectiveness.

content.text: Time: minimize exposure time. Distance: maximize distance from radiation source (inverse square law). Shielding: use appropriate barriers. Activity: use minimum radioactive source strength necessary for clinical objectives.

Proper training, regular safety meetings, dose monitoring programs, equipment maintenance, optimization of procedures, and regular review of radiation protection practices to identify improvement opportunities.

ALARA is mandated by regulatory bodies including NRC, state agencies, and international organizations. Facilities must demonstrate ALARA compliance through policies, procedures, and dose monitoring programs.
